content:
ber 10, 2014
												DO NOT BUY THIS GAME !!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Whist I recommend the gameplay it's self, I do not recommend buying this title, as it's broken.I have made a ticket asking Steam to Put a warning up so people do not buy this version...like me...and waste good money that could be spent on a working Beat Em Up.The game it's self is marvelous! It's pure greatness, as you'd expect from SF!....But....1) The game doesn't work unless you rename a file in the game directory (The fix is at the end of my review)2 ) Once you've sorted that and launch the game...you can play fine....but.you are unable to save any progress, because Games for Windows Live is dead. So any characters you unlock are lost...I am so dissapointed by this purchase. I really was looking forward to spending a few nights unlocking content, but not like this... One can only hope Steam do something to fix this fiasco =(Personal rating: Great game, crappy services embedded into it ruining itPercent Rating: 95% if it worked properly, but as it stands 5%....---------------------------The fix to make the game launch below...1) Go to the game folder  C:\SteamLibrary\SteamApps\common\Street Fighter IV 2) Find the file in that folder StreetFighterIV.exe.cfg   3) Change it's name toStreetFighterIV.exe.cfg.BAK4) Then try to launch as normal, it should work.5) If that doesn't work, install GFWL from the exe in that same folder and try again.6) Enjoy your game till you realise you can't save progress7) OPTIONAL STEP: Curse profusely at the fact you spent good money on a broken game...:

content:
23, 2014
												If you're a fan of the Street Fighter franchise it is mandatory for you to pick this one up. At this point it might be better to purchase Super Street Fighter IV as it offers a bigger rooster. Also, Ultra Street Fighter IV is scheduled to be released this year around the summertime.There are not many old-school fighter games on PC these days. You have the remade Mortal Kombat, too, so there isn't really anything else out there for us PC gamers. Just make sure you have a controller as with the keyboard it is a pain in the ♥♥♥♥ to play the game.Interestingly, the story takes place right after Street Fighter II ended. Chronologically, the game can be put between the 2nd and 3rd episode. Bison's Shadaloo organisation still exists and organises another tournament to gather the best fighters in the world - this time, however, instead of Bison you have Seth as the final boss. Seth combines the best moves of all the players out there - he has a lot of counter special attacks, very agile and overall a pain on harder difficulty settings.Gradually, you can learn to fight with each SF character and can continue to play online. You need a lot of time and effort to master these fighters. You can unlock many more as you progress through the game.Overall, this is a really good game. When I was young my parents bought me Street Fighter II for the Super NES so for me this game was instantly captivating.

												Note: This game been tried out and reviewed in Steam offline mode or on Consoles.Street Fighter 4 is a fantastic action game.Those who are new to Street Fighter genre will also find this game addictive.For beginners, Training modeCommand list which explains the moves & combos of each character is easy to understand & learn.Challenge Mode includes Time Attack, Survival & Trial Mode.SF4 has 25 characters which include old ones like Ryu, Ken, etc. & new ones like Rufus, C.Viper, El.Fuerte, etc. & two Secret characters i.e. Akuma & Gouken.Gouken [Shen Long] is the elder brother of Akuma [Gouki] & teacher of Ryu.New feature includes the Ultra Combo i.e. Revenge GaugeThis game is actually 2D rendered in 3D graphics. Controller/Joystick is recommendedPlaying this game only with a keyboard can be tough & troublesome. Overall: a fantastic game & Highly recommended.

content:
r 30, 2016
												Street Figher IV is an upgraded version of the Classic Street Fighter.There is many powerful, characters in the game. You have to know what "kind of character" they are in ordered to beat any opponent in the game, including Seth/Akuma/Gouken. Many characters are flat like Abel, C.Viper and El Fuerte. Trying to master the concepts and moves of these 3 characters in specific, is probably one of the hardest things to do.Many other characters are easy to use and have poweful moves per hit. For example, Akuma and Gouken. These 2 characters are yet the most powerful chracter in the game besides Seth. Knowing when to use what move, and performing these moves easily, can gain you a HUGE advantage over your opponent.Finally, this game is only great to a certain extend. After unlocking Seth (which by that you have to beat arcade mode with all the characters once), the game gets boring. Beating arcade mode with all the characters including the ones you need to unlock.*SPOILER ALERT* Gouken is the hardest character to unlocked out of all of them (Fei Long, Cammy, Rose, Sakura, Dan, Gen). You have to beat arcade mode using Akuma once, then use any character you have previously beat arcade mode with, and must acheive 1 perfect round, which means you cannot take any damage from your opponent, 3 super/ultra combo finish (these add up), and 5 First-Attack rounds. Oh, most importantly, you cant use ANY continues (including Seth). After beating Seth (for the first time), Gouken will appear. He will use the cheapest moves against you, so be aware. I've unlocked Gouken on the first try after unlocking Akuma.Easiests way to unlock Gouken, is to use Akuma.*SPOILER ALERT* To unlock Akuma, you must unlock all the other characters besides Gouken (Fei Long, Cammy, Rose, Sakura, Gen, Dan). This is yet the second to the cheapest character in the entire game. His moves are powerful, easy to accomplish. His ultra and Special Combo is ONLY one button different (moving left and right). In the end, this game shows many great style of martial arts from many different countries, some even made up (M. Bison, Seth, Akuma). Great game to learn/understand the different kinds of martial arts from different countries.

er 25, 2013
												This is the title that jumped the franchise again. Although it's only the vanilla version and you'll be better off with the Arcade one or just waiting for the Ultra Street Fighter 4 that's coming out next year, it's still a gem of fighting games. Brings back old memories spamming Hadokens and Dragon Punches! I'm not going to say I'm a good player at this, but it is fun in the end. Get it if you don't want to pay so much for the Arcade version or the Ultra that's coming out next year. Ultimately, though, get it when it's on sale. It makes it worth it. $20 for a fighting game that's having so many other versions isn't that much of a deal.8/10 when it's on sale. (:5.5/10 if not. /: happy new year guys :D

ber 17, 2016
												I wanted to play Street Fighter on my personal computer being familiar with the game considerably and am very happy to have bought this game, Street Fighter IV, despite as a result not being able to afford the superior SFV for the present time. I would recommend this as a great game to own due to its originality but also for the normal Street Fighter reasons, like to practice or improve, train and experience online battles.I would just like to add that I bought this game as a kind of prologue to the Street Fighter V level and I do not regret that at all!I would also like to add that the game does contain one negative with its age from release date now, this creating a lack in numbers of people playing online as they're no longer participating with SFIV.I must also add, as it is such a frequent debate within Street Fighter IV on PC forums, that the requirement for Games for Windows Live to be installed onto your computer and also to create an account in order to be able to make this run (An Xbox account) does create a challenge to play the game, I find this worthwhile but understand why some may not.

3, 2011
												Everything nostalgic and classic from SF2 while having all of the modern bells and whistles to mix into a great game.Edit, I wrote this review on June 23 2011, and as of November 2013, the multiplayer servers are completely 100% empty.  People have moved on to Super Street Fighter 4 Champion Platinum's Turbo X2 Alpha Strike Collector's Limited Special Edition Gold.  Or whatever the ♥♥♥♥.  All that's left here is GFWL achievements to single player.  I managed to get like 10/48, the rest of them are challenge mode.  You have to be autistic or something to pull off the combos.  I'm not talking about Ryu's Hadouken, I'm talking about some advanced ♥♥♥♥ that you don't have the fingers for if you're over 8.Bottom line, if you really want to play Street Fighter, get the new one that everyone plays.  Whatever that is now.

												This is an excellent game, let down by being tied into Games for Windows Live (GFWL).  I was forced to sign into GFWL in order to save my progress, which is a pain in the behind when streaming the game to a Steam Machine.  GFWL offers nothing useful and just gets in the way.  If you can put up with the annoyance of being tied to such a useless system, the game is absolutely wonderful in every way.  Let's hope that Capcom doesn't make the same mistake for future Street Fighter games.

11, 2015
												I, for some reason have this in my Steam and it's not that bad. I was expecting it to be utter rubbish because fighting games on PC just seem like too crazy of an idea to work but it does. ...Once you get the hang of it. Because button mashing was designed for either classic arcade controls or controllers. It's really hard to do that on a PC keyboard despite the mashings we've all pretty much done when we are trying to communicate via text or frustration or anger.  You really have to know the buttons that make the combos if you ever want to make progress. Anyway, I'll spare the mechanics of gameplay because even if you've never picked up a fighting title before, it's clear what to do and how to do it. This is a decent game. If you want to drop cash and play it on the PC for some reason, go right on ahead.
